SEARCH
Package utilities

Class Sorter<T>

java.lang.Object
utilities.Sorter<T>
public class Sorter<T> extends Object
The Sorter class provides multiple sorting algorithms to order Shape objects. It supports several classic algorithms — Bubble, Insertion, Selection, Merge, Quick, and Heap Sort — all designed to work in *descending* order using a given ShapeComparator (which defines whether to compare by height, volume, or area). Each sorting method operates directly on the given array of Shape objects, modifying it in place. The class is used by the main program to dynamically select and execute the user's chosen sort method.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sorter

      public Sorter(Comparator<T> comparator)
      Constructs a new Sorter instance using the specified comparator to define how elements in an array will be compared and ordered.

      This constructor allows the sorting behavior to be customized for different comparison strategies — for example, sorting shapes by height, base area, or volume. The provided comparator determines the logic used during sorting.

      Parameters:
      comparator - the Comparator used to compare elements during sorting. Must not be null, otherwise a NullPointerException may occur when performing comparisons.

  • Method Details

    • sortUsing

      public void sortUsing(String sortType, T[] array)
      Selects and executes the sorting algorithm based on the user's input.
      Parameters:
      sortType - The character code representing the sorting algorithm (b, i, s, m, q, or h)
      array - The array of Shape objects to sort

    • mergeSort

      public void mergeSort(T[] array)

    • getSortName

      public String getSortName(String sortType)
      Helper method that returns the human-readable name of a sorting algorithm.
      Parameters:
      sortType - A character indicating the sorting type
      Returns:
      The name of the sort type as a string
